sorular.soru: In which situation should you let the oncoming car go first?

feedback.metin: In the upper left, bottom left and bottom right situations you have to let the oncoming car go first. As soon as a traffic light is a round bulb and you want to turn left, oncoming traffic can have green at the same time as you, and the rule ‘through traffic on the same road goes before traffic turning off’ still applies. If traffic lights are out of order, this rule also applies. Only when you approach a traffic light with a green arrow, you can be sure you don't have to let oncoming traffic go first.

sorular.soru: At which sign are  snorfietsers  allowed to drive on at a red traffic light if they are turning right?

feedback.metin: The VR-4 sign indicates that cyclists (and snorfietsers) approaching from all directions have a green light at the same time. The sign does not say they are allowed to turn right despite the red light. The VR-5 and VR-6 signs indicate that cyclists (and snorfietsers) turning right are allowed to continue at yellow and red traffic lights. This is only allowed if it does not hinder other traffic. The VR-5 sign also applied to mopeds.
